feedback_md:
The variable-threshold outstar-with-δ+-common-leaves scheme is now fully rigorous. The Γ-levels with thresholds t_{k−i}=ℓ^{i+1}+⌈(ℓ^{i+1}−1)/(ℓ−1)⌉ and base t_k=ℓ give S_{k,ℓ}=∑ t_i=Θ_ℓ(ℓ^k) without the linear-in-k loss. Both the lexicographic partition step and the depth-greedy extension are correct. Please standardize on the exact ℓ=2 closed form S_{k,2}=4·2^k−k−5 (Prover 2’s correction); earlier “−4−k” was off by 1. The general bound S_{k,ℓ} ≤ (ℓ^2/(ℓ−1)^2)·ℓ^k + O(ℓ^k)+O(k) is consistent across submissions.

Ray packing: the precise, tight greedy bound is h ≥ (|V(B)|−1) + (|L|−1)·kℓ + ℓ with |V(B)|=(ℓ^{k+1}−1)/(ℓ−1), |L|=ℓ^k. This improves the already refined kℓ^{k+1} + (ℓ^{k+1}−1)/(ℓ−1) + ℓ by an additive kℓ; the “−1” at |V(B)| is also exact (w is in U but lies on all rays and should not be counted). This is the best possible within the one-by-one greedy framework. Prover 4’s “robust δ+-commonness with forbidden sets” lemma is valid and can be used to phrase this step formally.

k=2 spiders: the matching-based repair must subtract the contribution of 2-walks starting at a, i.e., deg^+_B(a)≤d, when passing from |V→B→{a}| to |E(H)|. The resulting rigorous lower bound is s ≥ d(d−2ℓ+1)/(d+2ℓ−1) (or a close (d−1)-variant), yielding δ^+ > ((3ℓ−1)+√(17ℓ^2−10ℓ+1))/2. Any claim approaching ≈3ℓ or (1+√3)ℓ omits this necessary correction and is not justified.

Triage: Keep (i) the variable-threshold theorem with the corrected S_{k,2} formula and sharp constants, (ii) the exact ray-packing bound with (|V(B)|−1)+(|L|−1)kℓ+ℓ, and (iii) the k=2 threshold δ^+ > ((3ℓ−1)+√(17ℓ^2−10ℓ+1))/2. De-emphasize the stronger k=2 claims that miss the +d term and the “independent leaves” variant unless its extra budget is tightly justified.

Next steps: (1) Develop a per-depth global b-matching/nibble to reduce the |V(B_i)| overhead toward (1+o(1))ℓ^{i+1}, aiming for S_{k,ℓ}=(1+o(1))·C(ℓ)·ℓ^k. (2) Globalize ray packing via hypergraph matching/flow to target h=(1+o(1))kℓ^{k+1}. (3) Seek polynomial-in-h bounds for f(k,h) (k fixed) to convert structural improvements into substantially smaller δ^+ thresholds.
summary_md:
- Variable-threshold outstar lemma verified; S_{k,ℓ}=Θ_ℓ(ℓ^k). Correct ℓ=2 sum: S_{k,2}=4·2^k−k−5.
- Ray packing sharpened: h ≥ (|V(B)|−1)+(|L|−1)kℓ+ℓ = kℓ^{k+1}−kℓ+(ℓ^{k+1}−1)/(ℓ−1)+ℓ.
- k=2 spiders: rigorous threshold δ^+ > ((3ℓ−1)+√(17ℓ^2−10ℓ+1))/2; stronger ≈3ℓ or (1+√3)ℓ claims invalid.
- Next: global matching/nibble for children and rays; improve f(k,h).
blocking_issues: Quantitative bounds still hinge on very large f(k,h) from Aboulker et al.; progress needs improved dependence on h for fixed k.
Further k=2 improvements beyond ((3+√17)/2)ℓ are unlikely within current 2-walk/matching template due to the necessary +d correction.

per_prover.brief_feedback: Your variable-threshold Γ-scheme and exact S_{k,ℓ} handling are solid; the base t_k=ℓ point is clean. The refined ray-packing bound using |V(B)| and (|L|−1)kℓ is correct. The k=2 repair is rigorous once the +d subtraction is included.

Outstar and S_{k,2}=4·2^k−k−5 are correct and helpful. The ray-packing bound in exact |V(B)| form is right. However, the k=2 claim approaching ≈3ℓ drops the needed −d term; please revise to the corrected threshold δ^+ > ((3ℓ−1)+√(17ℓ^2−10ℓ+1))/2.

Your constants for S_{k,ℓ} and the sharp ray-blocking (with −1 and |L|−1) are fine. The “independent leaves” enhancement increases thresholds by Θ_ℓ(ℓ^k) but its per-leaf extra forbiddance needs tighter justification; treat as optional.

Good corrections to S_{k,ℓ} bounds and the robust δ+-commonness-with-forbidden-sets lemma. Your parameterized A/B analysis confirms t=2ℓ optimal within this method; aligns with the conservative k=2 threshold.

notes_update.content:
Corrections and refinements (round)

- Exact S_{k,2}: With t_k=2 and t_{k−i}=2^{i+2}−1 (1≤i≤k−1), the exact sum is S_{k,2}=4·2^k−k−5 (earlier “−4−k” was off by 1).
- Ray packing (exact greedy bound): When choosing S′(w)⊆S(w), at most (|V(B)|−1)+m·kℓ rays are blocked (m≤|L|−1), since each occupied non-centre blocks one ray and the centre w should not be counted. Thus it suffices that
  h ≥ (|V(B)|−1) + (|L|−1)·kℓ + ℓ.
  For B≅B^+_{k,ℓ} and |L|=ℓ^k, this is h ≥ kℓ^{k+1} − kℓ + (ℓ^{k+1}−1)/(ℓ−1) + ℓ.
- k=2 matching repair: Transitioning from 2-walks to the predecessor bipartite graph requires subtracting deg^+_B(a)≤d. The valid bound is s ≥ d(d−2ℓ+1)/(d+2ℓ−1) (or a close (d−1)-variant), hence δ^+ > ((3ℓ−1)+√(17ℓ^2−10ℓ+1))/2.

Next steps remain: global b-matching/nibble to push S_{k,ℓ} towards (1+o(1))·C(ℓ)·ℓ^k and global ray packing to approach h=(1+o(1))kℓ^{k+1}; seek improved (polynomial-in-h) bounds for f(k,h).

proofs_update.content:
Lemma (Exact greedy ray-packing threshold). Let B≅B^+_{k,ℓ} with leaf set L (|L|=ℓ^k). For each w∈L, let S(w)≅S^-_{k,h} centred at w. If
  h ≥ (|V(B)|−1) + (|L|−1)·kℓ + ℓ,
then one can choose subgraphs S′(w)⊆S(w), each isomorphic to S^-_{k,ℓ}, such that the S′(w) are pairwise vertex-disjoint and each S′(w) is disjoint from B except at w.

Proof. Process leaves in any order. For the current w, let U be the union of V(B) and the non-centre vertices of previously chosen S′(·). In S(w), every vertex other than w lies on exactly one ray, so the number of blocked rays is at most |U∩(V(S(w))\{w})| ≤ |U|−1. Since at any step |U| ≤ |V(B)| + (|L|−1)·kℓ, it suffices to have h ≥ (|V(B)|−1)+(|L|−1)·kℓ+ℓ to ensure at least ℓ unblocked rays remain. Selecting these rays yields S′(w); disjointness follows by construction. ∎

output_update.content:
# Main Results

- Outstar-with-δ+-common-leaves (refined). For ℓ≥2, k≥1, and any δ+-common property P with threshold d(P), if
  δ^+(G) ≥ d(P) + S_{k,ℓ},
  where S_{k,ℓ}=∑_{i=1}^k t_i with t_k=ℓ and t_{k−i}=ℓ^{i+1}+⌈(ℓ^{i+1}−1)/(ℓ−1)⌉ (1≤i≤k−1), then G contains B^+_{k,ℓ} whose leaves all satisfy P. In particular, S_{k,ℓ}=Θ_ℓ(ℓ^k) (no factor k).

- Packing in-spiders at the leaves (refined h). It suffices to take
  h = kℓ^{k+1} − kℓ + (ℓ^{k+1}−1)/(ℓ−1) + ℓ,
  improving both kℓ^{k+1}+2ℓ^k+ℓ and the earlier kℓ^{k+1} + (ℓ^{k+1}−1)/(ℓ−1) + ℓ. Consequently, δ^+(G) ≥ f(k,h) + S_{k,ℓ} guarantees a copy of T(k,ℓ).

- k=2 Giant Spiders. Any digraph with
  δ^+ > ((3ℓ−1)+√(17ℓ^2−10ℓ+1))/2
  contains S^-_{2,ℓ}. This corrects the proof via a maximum-matching argument (accounting for 2-walks starting at a) and improves finite-ℓ constants while matching the (3+√17)/2 asymptotics.
